title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes:
Crashes after splash screen, likely requires nvapi and nvapi64 to be 
disabled and Proton to have a updated Wine version. Works on Wine 
Staging Esync 3.14 and DXVK 0.70

title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes: The game randomly freezes then crashes a few seconds later. Happens too quick to move through a level.

title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes:
Need to start steam in offline mode.
Game might need to be started with -4kb argument first time.

title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes: Running in Offline Mode is mandatory for stability. "-4kb" no longer required, DXVK can switch between fullscreen, windowed, and borderless window fine now. Threaded workloads slower than Wine Esync 3.14 causing dips below 60fps which can be fixed with newer upstream Wine. Level "Un-Bearable" is broken.

title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes: You have to run steam in offline mode

title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
notes: Needs offline mode, -4kf or -4kb launch option for first launch, some graphical glitches on loading screens and start menu. Aside from that, the game runs fine.
Has to be started in offline mode, but works fine after that.
title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy

notes: Game has to be run in offline mode, or it will crash. Performance is good. Controllers are not being detected, unless buttons are binded to keyboard keys in controller config.
title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy

notes: Runs great with Proton 3.16, offline mode is no longer necessary
title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy

notes: No graphical issues that I could see, the performance did seem to be worse than on Windows. Alt-tabbing caused the game window to be cropped when switching back to it, restarting the game seemed to be the only fix,
title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy

notes: I just played a little in one level, but except the intro that the audio goes out of sync, nothing else seems to fail.
title: Crash Bandicoot™ N. Sane Trilogy
